resources.string: The app needs View Calls permission in order to show calls history
The app needs Contacts permission in order to show the Contacts screen
Outgoing calls are currently restricted to Favorites. To enable this feature, please go to Settings. You can still call your Gold Number, if set.
Outgoing calls are currently restricted to Contacts. To enable this feature, please go to Settings. You can still call your Gold Number, if set.
Outgoing calls are currently turned off. To enable this feature, please go to Settings. You can still call your Gold Number, if set.
For optimal call handling, it is important to set the app as your default phone app. Are you sure you want to skip this step?

For the app to run smoothly in the background, please set the Battery saver to \'No restrictions\', in the Background Settings, through \'App info\' in Settings. The app is designed for minimum battery use.
Permission couldn’t be granted automatically. You can enable it in Settings.
In order to make calls, the app must have the proper permission
To add a Gold Number, please go to Settings by tapping the three-dot menu.
View Contacts permission was granted! Reloading…
In order to read Contacts details, the app must have the proper permission
In order to view calls history, the app must have the proper permission
The app needs Phone permission to make calls, including Quick Call.
Enable app to show Call screen from background
Please enter \'Other Permissions\' and there grant access to \'Display pop-up windows while running in the background\'.

To let the app show pop-up windows during calls, the \'Draw over other apps\' permission must be enabled in your device settings. On Xiaomi phones, you\'ll need to turn this permission on manually. Tap below to open settings and enable it.
Default Phone App (Dialer) permission was not granted but needed for the app to answer calls.
Phone (outgoing calls) permission denied, but needed to make outgoing calls.
Read Contacts permission was denied but needed in order view Contacts.
Calls Log permission was denied but needed in order view calls.
To filter blocked contacts, please set the app as the default app.
It is important to set the app as your default phone app to allow it to handle outgoing calls for you.

The app was designed specifically to simplify managing and placing calls, in addition to answering incoming calls – by using a large button instead of swiping on the device, an action that can sometimes be challenging for older people.

Family members can change the settings as needed, making the app both simple and powerful with many features.

Manage your calls easily and use the app as your primary dialer for receiving and managing calls.

The app includes a wide range of useful features, specifically tailored for seniors, to manage all types of calls, both incoming and outgoing.\n\nThe app is designed to be very simple and easy to use, but you can always change the settings easily by tapping on the menu at the top of the screen (tap on the three dots).

In the Settings screen, you can choose who can call you, such as only contacts, only favorites, or only identified numbers.

You can also restrict outgoing calls if necessary. It is important to remember that Quick Call and the Gold Number will still work even if outgoing calls are restricted or blocked, as they depend solely on the phone's outgoing call permission.

Additionally, you can choose to start calls with the speakerphone on, set the app to answer calls automatically, and access other options that help the app function in the most customized and optimal way for you.

It is possible to enable the app to automatically answer incoming calls, without the need to press the answer button when a new call is received.

The app allows the device to ring a few times, so that you will be alerted to the incoming call.

Auto answering can be enabled only for certain contacts, by tapping on them in the Contacts screen and then checking the checkbox.

Using this option may cause confusion for those who are not accustomed to auto answering, and its use is solely the responsibility of the user.

You can set up a Gold Number for simple and easy calls to a close contact using the settings screen, and then call them via the Contacts tab or the dialer.\n\nYou can call the Gold Number even when outgoing calls are restricted in the app, but it does require call permission.

For the app to be able to manage calls and answer them even when it is not running, it must be set as the default call management app.

Additionally, for the app to function properly, it requires additional permissions:
\1. Phone (for making calls).
\2. Opening new windows in the background (display above other apps).
3. Access to contacts.
4. Viewing the call log.
5. Permission to display on the lock screen.

The app will only use the permissions it has received solely for proper call management.

Most of the device permissions required for the app are automatically granted during installation or when setting the app as the default for calls.

Permissions can always be requested through the app's permissions screen, using the menu at the top of the screen (the 'three dots' menu).

It is recommended to seek help from family members and close contacts, if needed.

To ensure the app can answer phone calls even when it is not open, make sure to grant the necessary permission.

To proceed:
1. Open the device settings.
2. Navigate to the "Other permissions" section (or similar).
3. Find and enable the relevant permission.

Note: The name and location of the permission may vary depending on the device. If it cannot be found, try looking in other settings sections.

To ensure the app can answer phone calls even when it is not open, make sure to grant the necessary permission.

To proceed:
1. Tap "Display over other apps."
2. Enable the "Allow display over other apps" option.

Note: The exact location and name of this setting may vary depending on your device and Android version.

To ensure the app can answer phone calls even when it is not open, make sure to grant the necessary permission.

To proceed:
1. Tap "Appear on top."
2. Enable the "Allow permission" option.

Note: The exact location and name of this setting may vary depending on your device and Android version.

To ensure that the app functions properly and manages calls, it must be set as the default call management app.\n\nWithout this permission, the app will not be able to answer calls when it is not open and in focus.

To ensure the app runs smoothly in the background and can answer calls, please make sure that no restrictions are applied to its operation in the device settings.

Please set the battery saving mode for the app to "Unrestricted". This can be done via the "App Details" in the settings menu under the background settings.

Note: Battery saving settings may vary between devices. The key is to ensure that the device does not restrict the app's operation.

The app is designed for minimal battery consumption.

To keep the app running smoothly in the background, it is important to set the Battery saver to have no restrictions. The app is designed for minimum battery use. Are you sure you want to skip this step?
In order for the app to handle calls from the background (while it\'s not loaded), it is important to grant Overlay Draw permission. Are you sure you want to skip this step?
Enable app to show Call screen from background
Please enter \'Other Permissions\' and there grant access to \'Display pop-up windows while running in the background\'
The app needs a few permissions in order to manage your calls in a clear and friendly way.
The app must become the default Calls handler (Default App/Dialer) in order to receive and make phone calls. Granting this permission usually trigger the Contacts, Phone and Calls view permissions.
The Overlay Draw permission is required for Call Display, from the background, when the app itself is not loaded, for incoming and active calls.
The app needs Phone (Call) permission in order to make phone calls as the Default Phone App for handling calls.
The application needs Contacts permission in order to let you call existing Contacts and to show the Contacts of phone numbers.
The application needs to have the Phone Log permission in order to show recent Incoming and Outgoing calls.
The app cannot add contacts to the Gold Number selection list because it does not have Contacts permission. You can grant it in the app\'s permissions screen.
Phone (Make calls) permission granted! Please try again
Read Contacts permission granted! Please try again
The app is not the default phone app (dialer). Please select it as the default or make the call anyway through another phone app
App was selected as default phone app (dialer)! Please try again.
In order to view calls history, the app must have the proper permission.
Contacts permission was not granted. Showing Calls list with phone numbers only.
In order to display the calls\' Contacts, the app must have the proper permission.
Cannot show contact name because the contacts permission is not granted. Please enable this permission in the app or device Settings.
Cannot continue since permission was not approved.

Your outgoing call setting is set to “Favorites Only”, but no favorite contacts are defined on your device. To view the rest of the contacts, you can either add them to favorites or change the settings in the app (open the app\’s settings menu via the three dots menu and change the outgoing call option to “Contacts” or everyone).

App selected as default phone app!
It looks like the app encountered an error in the last call (Error: %1$s).

Please enable the "Show on lock screen" permission.

To enable this permission, please follow these steps:
1. Open your device settings.
2. Navigate to the "Other Permissions" category.
3. Locate the "Show on lock screen" option and enable it.

Please note: On different devices, the permission may appear under a different name or in a different location. If you cannot find it, try looking in other settings categories.
Oops! A serious error occurred. Please restart the app.
Tap the Call item for details
Tap the Contact row for details

The app requires permission to run in the background, in order to answer calls when it is not in focus. You can grant this permission either through the app\’s Permissions screen or by adjusting the app’s settings in your device’s settings menu.
No contacts are displayed because outgoing calls are disabled. You can change this option in the app\'s Settings menu.

Welcome to the %1$s application.

The application has been developed as an aid tool for adult users, and its purpose is to facilitate easier call management on Android devices and enable quick contact with predefined contacts.

The application and the services provided through it shall hereinafter be referred to as "the System".

1. Agreement to the Terms:
Use of the System is subject to the following Terms ("the Terms"). Please read these Terms carefully before using the System. Your use of the System constitutes your full and irrevocable acceptance of these Terms.

If you do not agree to these Terms, in whole or in part, please do not use the System and remove it from your device immediately.

2. Summary of the System's Purpose:
Facilitating easier call management by emphasizing large buttons and text optimized for elderly users.

3. Important Clarification Regarding Quick Call and Automated Call Answering:
* It is recommended to initially test the Quick Call functionality with predefined contacts to ensure proper operation.
* The System includes a Quick Call feature designed for fast dialing to a predefined phone number and may also offer automated call answering and a "golden number" function.
* Please note that the application is not designed for use in emergency situations and does not replace direct communication with official assistance centers.
* Dependence solely on Quick Call or automated call answering is not recommended, as technical issues may arise (e.g., signal issues, network failures, permission blocks, operating system limitations, or battery-saving restrictions).
* It is recommended to maintain additional backup methods for communication.

4. Privacy, Personal Data Protection, and Call Recording:
The System enables users to view various data stored on the smartphone, such as contacts and call logs saved on the device. This information is not stored within the application nor shared with any third party. Please note that the application does not record any telephone calls made through it, and the System does not store or log calls in any manner.

5. Usage Restrictions:
It is strictly prohibited to use the System for any purpose other than personal or private use, including the dissemination of false information using the Quick Call feature.

6. Liability and Limitation of Liability:
The application and the services provided therein are offered "as-is" ("AS-IS"). The developers are not responsible for adapting the System to the user's needs, for any errors, inaccuracies, or changes in the information displayed, or for any changes made by the user or third parties. The developers shall not be liable for any direct or indirect damages resulting from use of the System, including damages arising from call answering, automated call answering, the golden number, the Quick Call feature, or any other component of the application. Users assume all risk regarding use of the System, and the developers accept no liability for malfunctions, operational failures, or damages resulting from improper use or over-reliance on the System.

7. Changes, Updates, and Termination of Service:
The operators of the application reserve the right to modify, update, or discontinue the System at any time without prior notice.

8. Contact for Inquiries or Complaints:
For inquiries, complaints, or questions, please contact %3$s.

9. User Declaration and Consent:
Please note: This window is displayed solely for reading and reviewing the Terms and does not constitute acceptance. Acceptance of the Terms is done on the previous screen by selecting "%2$s".

By selecting "%2$s", you declare that you have read, understood, and fully agree to these Terms.

10. Intellectual Property Rights:
All content, features, and functionality within the System, including but not limited to software, text, graphics, logos, and design, are the exclusive property of the developers and are protected by intellectual property laws.

All Rights Reserved © %1$s 2025.
I agree to the Terms of Use
Please open and read the Terms of Use before proceeding.
Please approve the Terms of Use before finishing.

* It is recommended to first test the Quick Call button with a pre-defined contact to ensure it functions properly.

The Quick Call button allows you to quickly reach a pre-selected contact with a single tap.

Even if outgoing calls are restricted in the app's general settings, the Quick Call button remains functional as long as the device and system allow outgoing calls.

Please note: the app is not intended for emergency or safety-critical use and does not replace official communication services.

You can set a preferred contact (subject to contact permissions) that the app will dial when the Quick Call button is pressed.

Important: the Quick Call button requires phone call permissions (for outgoing calls) to function properly and may require additional system settings depending on your device.

It is recommended to set the app as the default phone app for optimal use.

If the Quick Call button shows a bell icon, it is ready to use. If not, please check your device settings and ensure all required permissions are granted.

If permissions are missing, you can grant them through the app's permissions screen or your device settings.
Warning: A number has been selected for the quick-call feature, but the "Phone" permission (Outgoing calls) is missing. Therefore, the quick-call feature cannot work.
Cannot add Contacts to the Quick-call number selection list. Please enable Contacts access via the app\'s permissions screen or your device settings.
Unable to display number selection for the Quick Call (App must be set as default)
Unable to display Quick Call contact selection (Contacts permission is required)
Making Quick Call! Tap Cancel to stop.
Quick Call number not found! Try the Gold Number.
Cannot add Contacts to the Gold Number selection list. Please enable Contacts access via the app\'s permissions screen or your device settings.
Phone (Make calls) permission granted! Please try again
Contacts permission granted! Please try again

Send a call report to a close contact.

Monitor call activity to help ensure everything is okay. You'll receive a clear summary of incoming and outgoing calls.

The report includes patterns like:

• Frequent calls to the same number
• Unknown or unsaved callers
• Outgoing calls made at unusual hours

It's a simple way to stay connected and aware, especially when caring for an aging parent.

You can always change the call report settings via the three-dots menu at the top of the screen.

Please note: You are solely responsible for how this information is used and shared. Make sure to respect privacy and comply with local laws regarding data use.
Call Report screen is already open
Select Contact to receive the report
A call is considered exceptional if it is NOT between
A number is considered exceptional if it appears more than
Number is considered exceptional if it\'s not in Contacts
Welcome to Easy Call And Answer!

The premium version of the app unlocks powerful features designed to significantly enhance your user experience — especially for Android users who need accessibility, ease of use, and remote control.

Full voice control lets you answer calls and perform actions — all without touching the device. Just make sure there's no background noise interfering with voice recognition.

You\’ll also benefit from a smart lock screen that allows you to quickly return to the app with a single tap.

A newly added feature is the call report — a useful tool that helps identify whether unwanted calls were received or accidental calls were made. The report is sent only to a number you choose, and the app does not store or use the data otherwise.

Responsibility for using these features — and the app in general — rests entirely with you, the user.
Swipe left to continue\nto the next step

Our smart lock screen offers a new and effortless experience.

Instead of struggling with awkward swipe gestures or figuring out how to unlock your device, a single tap takes you right back to the app. It's easy, fast, and always available when you need it.

If voice commands are available, you can also unlock the device using a voice command. No need to touch the device—just say the magic word, and the screen responds. Perfect when your hands are busy or you need quick access.

If available, the screen displays smart notifications from SMS and WhatsApp. Content is shown in read-only mode, so even if tapped by mistake, no chat will open. This is especially helpful for elderly users who may press something unintentionally.

With clean design, intuitive control, and voice support, it's a true upgrade to your mobile experience.

Imagine having full control of the app — without even touching your phone. Just speak, and it responds.

Answer calls, send emergency alerts, call loved ones, or unlock your screen — all using just your voice.

When your hands are busy or the screen is hard to reach, voice control makes things simple, quick, and natural.

It even works while you're moving or from across the room — as long as there's not too much background noise.

This isn\’t just about convenience. It\’s about accessibility, safety, and technology that puts you in control.

Stay informed about your loved one’s call activity. The report shows the incoming and outgoing calls — so you know they’re not calling by mistake or receiving calls from unknown or suspicious numbers.

The premium Quick Call makes it easier to stay connected. It places a call and sends an SMS with your location and time. If there\'s no answer or the call doesn\'t go through, a loud alert will sound to notify people nearby.

You can make your experience even smoother by setting up voice commands that work best for you.


It is advisable to choose commands that are easy to say, clear, and unique — this helps the app understand you better
Call your Gold Number contact hands-free.
The service is active! The Smart Lock Screen will appear when your device locks. You can adjust the settings anytime.

The Premium version offers enhanced features for Quick Call, along with a smart lock screen that appears automatically after inactivity. Tapping the screen takes you straight back into the app, so you can make a call easily without searching for it on the home screen.
Quick Call activated — please pay attention

The app uses SMS permission to send a text message to the selected %1$s.
Message sending depends on network availability and may involve charges.
Only up to 3 messages will be sent.
Note: The user is responsible for any costs or delivery issues.

Our smart lock screen offers a new and effortless experience.

Instead of struggling with awkward swipe gestures or figuring out how to unlock your device, a single tap takes you right back to the app, where you can manage and make phone calls with ease.

With a clean design and intuitive control, it's a true upgrade to your mobile experience.

We\'ve put a lot of heart and effort into creating this app to help seniors and people with disabilities manage their phone calls more easily and independently.\nIf you find it helpful, we\'d really appreciate it if you could rate us on Google Play. Your feedback means a lot and helps us keep improving!
